Silly Girl Lyrics[Intro]
(One, two, three, four)

[Verse 1]
Flowers bloomed when he walked
Angels sang when he talked
I laid my head down on my pillow and I
Dreamed

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm just a silly girl in a stupid, dumb, old world
I'm just a silly girl in a stupid, dumb, ol' world
And he is perfect
'Cause he's supposed to be
[Verse 2]
Smile at him in your math class
Strive for him to do the same
Open your eyes and realize he does not know your
Name
And he does not care to

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm just a silly girl in a stupid, dumb, old world
I'm just a silly girl in a stupid, dumb, ol' world
And he is perfect
Unlike me

[Bridge]

And how could I ever think that anything was made for me?

description.plain: This is a cute little tune written by Chloe Moriondo, a YouTube artist with one million (and counting) subscribers. It is said to be inspired by Dodie. It’s played softly on a ukulele.

song.embed_content: Read “Silly Girl” by ​chloe moriondo on Genius
song.title: Silly Girl

body.plain: This is a cute little tune written by Chloe Moriondo, a YouTube artist with one million (and counting) subscribers. It is said to be inspired by Dodie. It’s played softly on a ukulele.

annotations:
And he is perfect
 Unlike me

Chloe is saying that they don’t perceive themselves as perfect enough for him, and of course he doesn’t reciprocate or show feelings towards her because she’s not “perfect” for him when other people may be.

I made him perfect
 ’Cause I wanted him to be

She “made him perfect”, because he doesn’t actually exist. After several months this song was released, she comes out on Youtube. He was imaginary, or a random guy she used to hide behind when people asked if she like anyone.

Smile at him in your math class
 Strive for him to do the same

Chloe is showing her feelings, and he is just not returning them. This can either be because he genuinely doesn’t like her, or because he hasn’t noticed her. Both point to him not having and sort of reciprocating feelings for her.

I laid my head down on my pillow and I
 Dreamed
It is common to dream about someone that you like and let them take over your thoughts.

Flowers bloomed when he walked
 Angels sang when he talked

To Chloe, her supposed crush is perfect or unreal. Flowers don’t actually bloom and angels don’t actually sing when he talks, but to her these things could happen because they do in her dreams about him.
Angels singing is also associated with perfect or heavenly things, and so she uses this language to describe how amazing he is to her.

description_annotation.fragment: I Want to Be with You

range.content: I Want to Be with You

annotatable.link_title: I Want to Be with You by ​chloe moriondo
annotatable.title: I Want to Be with You

body.plain: “i want to be with you” is (obviously) a song about wanting to be with someone. chloe shares about how their love interest makes them act different than they do around other people.

annotations: I want to be with you

This line is repeated through the song, echoing through the first verse and repeated in the chorus. While this is the name of the song and so is expected to be repeated, this may also suggest how the thought of being with this person is constantly on her mind, and the thought returns over and over again.
I’ll make my bed

The first song on this album, “Rly Don’t Care”, includes the line:

“I’m really trying to make my bed more, ‘cause my dad says it helps with the blues.”

Meaning that Chloe wants to better herself as a person so she can be ready for a relationship with her crush.
My princess please, you know it’s all I want to do

despite in the previous line her talking about how her crush makes her unable to speak or know what to do with her body. she wants this person so bad that it doesnt make her uncomfortable to feel that way and that she even craves that feeling as long as she gets to be near her crush
You shut my mouth and you buckle my knees

she talks about a sort of starstruck act that happens whenever she gets around her crush. her desire to be liked by this person translates into anxiety or nervousness. “you shut my mouth/and you buckle my knees” means she cant speak and doesnt know what to do with her body when she is around her crush
Say what you mean
the person is unclear about how they feel about chloe. that or chloe is telling herself just to tell the person how she feels.
Straps on your glasses
samantha (the person chloe likes.) wears glasses. yungbugboy is her @ on instragram.
Swimming in my t-shirts no matter the weather
this may be because chloe feels uncomfortable with their body as swimming with a t-shirt on is something people do to hide their upper body.
And it’s almost unnatural how lame I act around you

chloe feels weird around the person that they love. with the person, chloe acts “lame” as she just feels weird. she says “it’s almost unnatural” because everyone has that feeling that they’re weird for not being able to talk to their crush.

No matter how hard I try

description.plain: “Bugbear” is a song about end-of-high school experience, graduation, and the worry of what’s to come of her future in the adult world, coming shortly after graduation.

song.embed_content: Read “Bugbear” by ​chloe moriondo on Genius
song.title: Bugbear

body.plain: “Bugbear” is a song about end-of-high school experience, graduation, and the worry of what’s to come of her future in the adult world, coming shortly after graduation.

annotations: Remain a beast
bugbear (the title of this song) is both a D&D monster and a word for a “hobgoblin … used to frighten children” (oxford languages)

No perception of time or space or distance, or weight
 And I think I’m going insane

Here, Chloe is referencing many common questions and insults that come up around someone’s late teens. One may find themselves asked such questions as “How do you justify the space you take up?” or be insulted with lines like “You’re a waste of time/space” or questions about their weight.
Can’t tell if this is the calm or if this is the storm

this, in the context of the previous line (sleeping through your days and skipping meals), could be referring to eating disorders and how they often feel right and safe but are destroying you at the same time, thus making it hard to tell if it’s “the calm” or “the storm”

So when I’m thrown into the adult world
 Where they do things that I never learned how to do
 I guess I’ll live in a swamp or a tree

This line is saying that she would want to live somewhere secluded or away from civilization so she wouldn’t have to face responsibilities that she wasn’t prepared for. She is also upset about the educational system and the fact that it does not teach you the basic things that one will need to know as one matures into an adult.

Sleepin’ through your days and skippin’ meals
 Must sound so unappealing
 But I guess it’s different when it’s the norm
Over sleeping and under eating are common  symptoms of depression

But it just sucks to try and explain
 Why I feel like this every day

Many introverts and extroverts alike may find it awkward or difficult to express their feelings of contempt. For example, if someone close to you does something recurrently that upsets you; you may find it very difficult to tell them. These are the exact thoughts going through Chloe’s head when she tries to explain how she feels.

This line is more referencing how she feels inferior to other adults who have years of experience or who know what they wanna do, while Chloe is just making music and struggling to do tasks people would see as normal because of a possible mental illness like depression (eating, getting out of bed, ect)
I feel so brain dead next to you

In the later stated outro, Chloe explains that she feels that “no matter how hard she tries, she’s still not trying hard enough to be great” and that she was “surrounded by school kids who all got their valedictorian course”. In saying these words, she’s explaining that she finds that she feels this sort of pressure to be great and to already have her future figured out. Chloe, being around people who do have their future decided and are so intelligent, feels that she doesn’t reach the standard that she and others give to her.

“Brain dead” is also a common ableist insult. In this context, Chloe is referring to the way society values the construct of intelligence, especially academic intelligence, and “brain dead” is referencing how society treats people with “less intelligence” as lesser.

I’m not quite sure where I’m goin’ next
 I’ll try to use a map but with directions I tend to be bad so
 I’ll use GPS and pray for the best

Chloe doesn’t know what she will do after graduating, and doesn’t have a clear career or life path laid out yet. “Try[ing] to use a map” represents her trying to figure out how to get where she wants to go for herself, but she claims she is bad at this, showing that she doesn’t trust her own decisions. Instead she defaults to using “GPS”. She is demonstrating a reliance on external directions, perhaps representing guidance from her school or parents, and she fears that she is not ready to be on her own as an adult.

No matter how hard I try
 I’m still not trying hard enough to be great

I think these lyrics relate pretty directly to the idea of being relatively gifted – as is emphasised by them following a reference to a 3.8 GPA, which is far from conventionally bad – but still feeling as though you’re not realising and reaching your full potential, perhaps due to mental health issues or simply a meer distaste for an academic system that renders finding motivation hard. Equally, it could allude to the fact that, particularly in the eyes of educational leaders, you can always theoretically be better and do more, irrespective of the psychological toll that overworking oneself can have; no matter how hard you work, there’s always the capacity to excel more in the eyes of society, and even by personally high standards. High school, and, more broadly, the world, seems to be an incessantly hierarchical capitalist structure wherein everyone strives for greatness. Particularly when you’ve been labelled as intelligent and talented since a young age, there’s a crushing degree of pressure to fulfil designated roles, and both a feeling of lost identity and disappointment when reaching such an intangible goal appears impossible.

My brain is surrounded by school kids
 Who all got their valedictorian cords
 While I couldn’t care enough about my 3.8

For those who were not American students, a valedictorian is a student who is at the top of their class and in their last year of high school (or secondary school). They achieved the best grades and did the best in their class overall. They recite a speech to the rest of their graduating class at the graduation ceremony. 3.8 refers to a grade point average, with 4.0 being the best one can achieve.

description.plain:
“Manta Rays” is the first single off of Chloe Moriondo’s sophomore album, Blood Bunny. It reflects themes of yearning and honesty with lyrics about deep desire and borderline obsession. Chloe has said:

The song is about an unhealthy attraction that I know a lot of teenagers can relate to. It was super cathartic to put all of my ideas into ‘Manta Rays’ and sing the chorus out as loudly and as emotionally as I wanted to. It makes me feel like I’m dreaming underwater.

In a 2020 interview with Flood Magazine, Chloe revealed that “Manta Rays” was the first song she ever wrote on guitar. Previously, she has written her music alongside a ukulele, as seen on her official YouTube channel.

song.embed_content: Read “Manta Rays” by ​chloe moriondo on Genius
song.title: Manta Rays

body.plain:
“Manta Rays” is the first single off of Chloe Moriondo’s sophomore album, Blood Bunny. It reflects themes of yearning and honesty with lyrics about deep desire and borderline obsession. Chloe has said:

The song is about an unhealthy attraction that I know a lot of teenagers can relate to. It was super cathartic to put all of my ideas into ‘Manta Rays’ and sing the chorus out as loudly and as emotionally as I wanted to. It makes me feel like I’m dreaming underwater.

In a 2020 interview with Flood Magazine, Chloe revealed that “Manta Rays” was the first song she ever wrote on guitar. Previously, she has written her music alongside a ukulele, as seen on her official YouTube channel.

annotations:
I wanna be your everything
 Wanna be more than what I am in general

The narrator doesn’t think much of themselves, but they want the person they’re obsessive over to see them the same way they do, that way they feel the relationship they dream of will happen.

The narrator also thinks that if they could better themselves then maybe they could get into the relationship – perhaps they blame themselves for not being good enough for the other person.

Wanna be your shining pearl, your one in the world, the type you wanna lean on
 Wish I were something suited for that

When you are obsessive over someone or strongly admire them, you want them to be the only person in your life and want you to be the only person in theirs.  This is a common thing done from people at this state.

But it’s all for you, it’s
 All for you, it’s
 All for you, it’s
 Always for you
 It’s all for you, it’s
 Never not for you, it’s
 All for you, it’s
 Still all for you

In the chorus, the narrator shows that they feel all the effort and pain she’s gone through and every complication in the obsession is all for the person they’re obsessed for, insisting that it’s not for themselves, and never has or will be, despite in many ways it indeed being a selfish obsession that’s eating away at them.

“Still all for you” could connote that despite being told no, or knowing it’s not gonna happen, that obsession is still there and they still think there might be a chance if they keep doing all of this for them.

This obsession of the narrator is reflected in the repetitive nature of this chorus. They’re so obsessed with this person that all they can think about is them and all they write/sing about is them.

My therapist will tell me that it’s best to let it be
 But I wanna light fires, I wanna explode, I wanna be everything you want to know

This obsession is definitely something effecting the narrator, to the point where they’re venting to their therapist about it, who’s told them that “it’s best to let it be”.

Despite this, the narrators fantasies have taken over, where they want to do all these incredible or spectacular things with the person in question, to the point where they’re everything to them.

And I know this is just how it goes
 I know, I know, I know, I know

The narrator has been in this situation before, or has learnt that these are the characteristics of an obsession. The repetition of “I know” could show that they are sick of being told that over and over that “this is just how it goes”.

I’m not obsessed, the feeling’s just there and I’m tryin’ hard to forget you
 Tryin’ hard to forget you

Snapping back on topic, the narrator is in denial. They don’t want to believe that they’re obsessed, and instead saying that “the feeling’s just there”, attempting to connote that it doesn’t really affect them.

But in many ways, they contradict this by understanding that it is a problem and it not being something they want, “trying hard to forget” the person in question, as they don’t want to obsess over them any more.
I never knew manta rays were so big ’til I got high and had to Google it

The narrator suddenly changes the subject, maybe their head is all over the place, or can’t focus on one topic for whatever reason, perhaps to distract themselves from the truth of what’s going on.

Manta rays are big. In fact, some can reach on average 7 meters in width!

Been tryna dream of you for so long I can’t even remember
 When I first decided your face was the one I wanted my mind to conjure

Many of Chloe’s songs contain imagery of ghosts and spirits as metaphors for fantasies, dreams and other relationships (such as in Ghost Adventure Spirit Orb). The word “conjure” is typically used to connote the raising of a spirit.

Here, this could connote that the narrator knows that the relationship is dead, or there’s no chance of it being alive in the first place, but is still retaining this unhealthy obsession for them, or even their image of them, trying to “conjure” them back in their mind whether they want it or not.

In addition, many people who suffer from obsessions with people or things can’t remember when or why it first started. These lines could also be interpreted as a suggestion that the narrator has been dreaming of somebody for such a long time that they’ve simply forgotten why they feel this way and it’s become normal for them to be unhealthily obsessed.
Don’t tell me that this means anything

Chloe is talking about her relationship with this girl, or possibly something the girl did which Chloe interpreted as a sign ‘that they like her’. She wants to believe the feeling is mutual yet has to tell herself that it most likely means nothing.

description.plain:
this song is about a confused sort of crush that Chloe refers to as “that feeling when you’re attracted to someone but you also kind of hate them” she writes about switching between wanting to fuck them and wanting to fight them and the frustration that she feels about admitting that she likes them.

ugh we love an enemies to lovers trope <3

song.embed_content: Read “Bodybag” by ​chloe moriondo on Genius
song.title: Bodybag

body.plain:
this song is about a confused sort of crush that Chloe refers to as “that feeling when you’re attracted to someone but you also kind of hate them” she writes about switching between wanting to fuck them and wanting to fight them and the frustration that she feels about admitting that she likes them.

ugh we love an enemies to lovers trope <3

annotations: I wanna kiss you on your cheeks, but I also wanna punch your teeth

Similar to where they state “don’t know if I hate you or if I wanna date you,” the singer/narrator/Chloe might “hate” this person, but secretly have a crush on them and want to be with them, although they are conflicted because of the feelings of resentment towards this individual.

I don’t wanna like you, I just wanna tie you up
 And keep you in a cage and watch you sleep for ages

Liking someone can be a somewhat bittersweet feeling, as you feel so desperate for them to like you back that it just isn’t fun to like that same person anymore if they’re just out of reach. Chloe describes that feeling in this song.

In these two lines, Chloe details not wanting to simply like this person, but to “tie them up and watch them sleep”. This suggests that Chloe feels too conflicted to pursue an actual relationship and instead wants to watch this person from afar…or perhaps just jump right into it.

description.plain:
“Kindergarten” is a deceptive ukulele-heavy queer anthem, released just months after Chloe came out as lesbian in August of 2019. The song describes the overwhelming feeling of a young crush. Chloe mentioned the concept of the song previously via a YouTube video:

liking a girl so much you feel like ur going crazy like your heart’s in kindergarten".

The track is Chloe’s first release since her debut album Rabbit Hearted, and 2019 single “Kalmia Kid.” The song was first released acoustically through a YouTube video as preparation for her tour, then later released officially along with another YouTube video on January 10.

body.plain:
“Kindergarten” is a deceptive ukulele-heavy queer anthem, released just months after Chloe came out as lesbian in August of 2019. The song describes the overwhelming feeling of a young crush. Chloe mentioned the concept of the song previously via a YouTube video:

liking a girl so much you feel like ur going crazy like your heart’s in kindergarten".

The track is Chloe’s first release since her debut album Rabbit Hearted, and 2019 single “Kalmia Kid.” The song was first released acoustically through a YouTube video as preparation for her tour, then later released officially along with another YouTube video on January 10.

annotations:
Do you wanna sit next to me on the bus home?
 I told my mom not to pick me up today
 I hope that that’s okay (ay-ay-ay-ayyyy)
Chloe is referring to things about elementary school/ kindergarten. In this line, you can tell its about younger age when she says “I told my mom not to pick me up today”
Hand
A hand is a body part that is on the end of an arm. It has five fingers and also some lines on the palm that (according to psychics) can predict your future
You’re sweeter than sugar, lover, I’m addicted

sugar and love both give dopamine rushes, the same chemical responsable to addiction to say: cocaine. So this comparison is very accurate.

Almost certainly not, but might reference grandmaster flash’s “white lines” about cocaine, saying:
“Twice as sweet as sugar, twice as bitter as salt
And if you get hooked, baby, it’s nobody else’s fault, so don’t do it!”
https://genius.com/Grandmaster-flash-white-lines-lyrics
Everything you do just makes my heart beat faster

everything you do just makes my heart beat faster-
is what you feel when you have a crush. its like that person is the source of your happiness. and you will never feel upset when that person’s around.
This thing is going further than originally planned
Chloe didn’t really plan for her crush to be so strong, she thought of it as a small “kindergarten” crush.
Bunny

definitely a tieback to the cover. The cover itself is a tie-in to her general branding (eg, rabbit hearted, and the music video for her song “Small.” Also, speaking of tie ins, bunny loops are a way of tying ones shoes often taught to kindergarteners
I’d surely be delighted to be the one you give the last Oreo to
A classic lunch snack food
[Verse 2]

Verse two is all about the classic feeling of UN-ease whenever you see your “crush”. In the song, Chloe wants to take that giant leap of expressing her feelings toward that person (girl; as it was in the music video and cause shes a LESBIAN lol), but winds of getting jumpy and nervous and decides to maybe just to keep arms length away

PROPOSED SUGGESTION: why does her face turn blue?

description.plain:
Ricky Montgomery’s second official remix is a collaboration with Indie pop artist-musician ​chloe moriondo, performing Ricky’s original song, “Mr. Loverman”. In this remix, Ricky’s feelings about his father’s alcoholism and abuse are still actively conveyed by the song, but Chloe’s vocals replace Ricky’s original vocals in the second verse and debuting a rewritten bridge that tries to show Ricky’s mother’s perspective, instead of his father’s.

In early March of 2021, Ricky announced on Twitter that there will be a second remix released on March 5th with yet another mystery artist, revealing the cover art without revealing the artist’s name.



Throughout the next day the 2nd of March, Montgomery announced on the social media platform TikTok that Chloe Monriondo was the next artist for the collaboration remix.

In early March of 2021, Ricky announced on Twitter that there will be a second remix released on March 5th with yet another mystery artist, revealing the cover art without revealing the artist’s name.

Just let me snot on your shoulder

And it won't stop

description.plain: “Waves” is a song about a time before Chloe struggled with mental illnesses and/or strong emotions. She uses the word waves as a metaphor for these feelings not being able to stop.

song.embed_content: Read “Waves” by ​chloe moriondo on Genius
song.title: Waves

body.plain: “Waves” is a song about a time before Chloe struggled with mental illnesses and/or strong emotions. She uses the word waves as a metaphor for these feelings not being able to stop.

annotations:
When instead of just my gooey brains
 All that melted was popsicles

The way she describes it here, “gooey brains” is the description of the empty and surreal feeling of derealization and depression. If your brain feels gooey it feels numb and without feeling, not whole, for example. Or like everything is slowed down.

Popsicles are of course an allusion to the nostalgic childhood dreams that she remembers.

It won’t stop
 It won’t stop
 It won’t stop
 It won’t stop

This taunting phrase is similar to the outro. It puts into perspective the way she feels, how fruitless her attempts to be happy have been. It is also slightly ironic the lines are repeating “it won’t stop” over and over.
